name: Maskman's Masked Marvels Quiz | Entertainment by Themes | 10 Questions

questions.text: The character Zorro was portrayed in film and television many times, most notably by Tyrone Power, Douglas Fairbanks and Antonio Banderas. Who portrayed Zorro on the television series which ran from 1957 to 1959?
questions.explanation:
Guy Williams.

	A new version of "Zorro" is a soap opera on the Spanish network Telemundo, starring Peruvian actor Christian Meier as Don Diego de la Vega.

questions.text: This man, a baseball player, had a very colorful way of speaking. Who spoke in a most convoluted manner?
questions.explanation:
Lawrence Berra.

	While Casey Stengel, could fit the bill...he didn't wear a mask as a player.   Lawrence Peter 'Yogi' Berra (born May 12, 1925) is a former Major League Baseball player and manager. Berra played most of his career for the New York Yankees. He was elected to the baseball Hall of Fame in 1972. Yogi was named Most Valuable Player of the American League three times. He is one of only six managers to lead teams in both leagues of American baseball to the World Series. Berra quit school in the eighth grade, has a tendency toward malapropism and fracturing the English language.  Berra once stated, "I never said half the things I really said."  When asked "What time is it?" Berra answered "Now?"

questions.text: Who starred in the movie "Phantom of the Paradise"?
questions.explanation:
Paul Williams.

	The diminutive Paul Williams starred as Swan in "Phantom of the Paradise" (1974). The film was a rock and roll version of "Phantom of the Opera," directed by Brian DePalma.

questions.text: What film featured Judge Reinhold in a mask?
questions.explanation:
"Ruthless People".

	In "Ruthless People" (1986), Judge and his partner kidnap the character played by Bette Midler.  He wears a mask as part of his disguise. The film also stars Danny DeVito and Helen Slater.

questions.text: Who was the co-director of the movie "Quick Change"?
questions.explanation:
Bill Murray.

	"Quick Change" (1990) starred Bill Murray, Geena Davis, Randy Quaid, and Jason Robards.  Murray, Davis and Quaid rob a bank dressed as clowns.  It is Murray's only directorial effort.

questions.text: Who starred in the original 1939 film "Man in the Iron Mask"?
questions.explanation:
Louis Hayward.

	"The Man in the Iron Mask" was first made 1939 and directed by James Whale.  It is an adaption of a portion of the novel 'The Vicomte de Bragelonne' by Alexandre Dumas, père.  The novel was based on the French legend of the Man in the Iron Mask.   There was a previous movie entitled "The Iron Mask" (1929), it was a silent film starring Douglas Fairbanks, but it's not the answer to the question.

questions.text: The Hanna-Barbera cartoon character Quick Draw McGraw had an alter ego who wore a mask.  What was his name?
questions.explanation:
El Kabong.

	El Kabong's weapon of choice was an acoustic guitar which he smashed over the heads of the bad guys.

questions.text: Of the Superheroes listed, which one did not wear a mask or cowl?
questions.explanation:
Wonder Woman.

	Wonder Woman is a DC Comics super-heroine and one of the three characters to be continuously published by DC Comics since the company began publishing in 1944. She is a founding member of the Justice League.

questions.text: In the film "Eyes Wide Shut," many actresses wore little other than masks.  Who directed "Eyes Wide Shut?"
questions.explanation:
Stanley Kubrick.

	Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman starred in "Eyes Wide Shut" (1999). It was Kubrick's last movie, he died prior to it's release.

questions.text: Was the name of the underwater television show starring Lloyd Bridges "Sea View?"
questions.explanation:
No.

	It was "Sea Hunt."  Bridges played Mike Nelson, a professional scuba diver who got involved in helping solve people's problems.  The show ran from 1958 to 1961, 155 episodes were filmed.  Many notable actors appeared in some episodes, including Leonard Nimoy, Robert Conrad, Larry Hagman and Jack Nicholson.  Bridges' sons Beau and Jeff were occasionally featured. At the end of each episode Bridges made a plea to protect the world's oceans.
